fields.name: Artificial Intelligence
fields.description: Study of creating computer systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence, including problem-solving, learning, reasoning, and understanding natural language.

fields.name: Machine Learning
fields.description: Field focused on developing algorithms and statistical models that enable computers to improve their performance on tasks through experience without being explicitly programmed.

fields.name: Computer Vision
fields.description: Research area concerned with enabling computers to gain high-level understanding from digital images or videos, mimicking human visual perception to interpret and analyze visual information.

fields.name: Robotics
fields.description: Interdisciplinary field integrating computer science, engineering, and AI to design, construct, and operate autonomous mechanical systems capable of interacting with physical environments.

fields.name: Data Science
fields.description: Field employing scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to extract knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data through computational approaches.

fields.name: Cybersecurity
fields.description: Discipline focused on protecting computer systems, networks, and data from digital attacks, unauthorized access, and information theft through technological and procedural safeguards.

fields.name: Information Security
fields.description: Practice of defending information assets by addressing confidentiality, integrity, and availability through technical controls, policies, and human factors considerations.

fields.name: Ethical Hacking
fields.description: Security practice involving authorized penetration testing and vulnerability assessment to identify and address security weaknesses before malicious actors can exploit them.

fields.name: Cryptography
fields.description: Science of securing communication and information through mathematical techniques and protocols that prevent unauthorized access while ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.

fields.name: Human-Computer Interaction
fields.description: Multidisciplinary field studying the design and use of computer technology, focusing on interfaces between humans and computers to create effective and intuitive interaction experiences.

fields.name: Interface Design
fields.description: Discipline concerned with creating visual, interactive elements of software systems that facilitate user interaction through careful consideration of usability, accessibility, and aesthetics.

fields.name: Usability Evaluation
fields.description: Systematic assessment of interactive systems to measure how effectively, efficiently, and satisfactorily users can accomplish specific tasks with particular interfaces.

fields.name: User Research
fields.description: Systematic investigation of user needs, behaviors, and motivations through observational methods, interviews, and empirical techniques to inform design decisions.

fields.name: Immersive Technologies
fields.description: Field developing technologies that blend digital content with physical reality, including virtual reality, augmented reality, and mixed reality systems to create compelling interactive experiences.

fields.name: Data Visualization
fields.description: Discipline focused on the graphical representation of information and data to facilitate understanding, pattern recognition, and insight generation through visual perception.

fields.name: Game Development
fields.description: Technical discipline encompassing programming, asset creation, and integration to produce interactive entertainment software with defined rules, challenges, and mechanics.

fields.name: Game Design
fields.description: Process of creating gameplay mechanics, rules, challenges, and narrative elements that form cohesive interactive experiences intended for player engagement and entertainment.

fields.name: Animation & Digital Media
fields.description: Field applying technology to create moving images, visual effects, and interactive content through frame-by-frame manipulation or procedural generation techniques.

fields.name: Computer Graphics
fields.description: Study of generating visual content with computers through algorithms and mathematical techniques for rendering, modeling, and simulating visual phenomena.

fields.name: Sound Design
fields.description: Creative practice of recording, manipulating, and generating audio elements to enhance interactive experiences, convey information, and evoke emotional responses.

fields.name: Interactive Media
fields.description: Field producing digital content that responds to user input or environmental conditions, combining multiple media formats to create engaging experiences with audience participation.

fields.name: Media Production
fields.description: Process of creating audiovisual content using technical expertise, creative direction, and production workflows from concept development through post-production and distribution.

fields.name: Digital Arts & Culture
fields.description: Interdisciplinary area exploring artistic expression, cultural phenomena, and creative practices enabled by digital technologies and their societal implications.

fields.name: Media Studies
fields.description: Academic discipline analyzing media forms, content, audiences, and institutions through cultural, social, economic, and historical frameworks.

fields.name: Health
fields.description: Applied field using computational methods and technologies to improve healthcare delivery, patient outcomes, medical research, and health system efficiency.

fields.name: Digital Healthcare
fields.description: Integration of digital technologies, data analytics, and telehealth solutions to transform healthcare delivery, monitoring, and management through technology-enabled approaches.

fields.name: Neuroscience
fields.description: Study of the nervous system's structure and function, using computational models and data analysis to understand neural processes, cognition, and behavior.

fields.name: Cognitive Psychology
fields.description: Scientific investigation of mental processes including perception, attention, memory, language, and reasoning through experimental methods and computational modeling.

fields.name: Physical Computing
fields.description: Discipline creating interactive physical systems using sensors, microcontrollers, and actuators that can sense and respond to the analog world.

fields.name: Smart Engineering
fields.description: Field developing intelligent systems integrating sensors, processing, and output capabilities to monitor environments, analyze data, and respond autonomously.

fields.name: Software Engineering
fields.description: Systematic application of engineering principles to develop, maintain, and evolve software systems through structured methodologies and practices.

fields.name: Web Technologies
fields.description: Development and application of technologies enabling creation, management, and evolution of internet applications, services, and interfaces.

fields.name: Mobile Development
fields.description: Specialized field creating software applications optimized for mobile devices considering platform constraints, user interaction patterns, and device capabilities.
